trial_identification.studytitle: A prospective study of the effects of weight loss on knee pain, function and appearance on x-ray in severely obese women.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A prospective study of the effects of weight loss on knee pain, function and appearance on x-ray in severely obese women.

interventions.interventions: 100 consecutive consenting severely obese women with knee pain who are presenting for weight loss surgery with the Lap-Band will have their knee symptoms clinically assessed in both knees, a standard set of x-rays of both knees taken and will answer the WOMAC questionnaire (a validated knee symptom and disability instrument) as well as a questionnaire designed to gather individual assessment of weight history, past knee injury and injury management, and activity and sporting volume history. The set of assessments will be repeated at 2-years.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Radiological changes in knees. Elucidation of factors that predict a greater prevalence of knee symptoms, dysfunction and degenerative arthritis in severely obese women presenting for Lap-Band surgery, assessment of any relationship with degree of weight loss and change in knee symptoms.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Body mass index greater than 35kg/m2, with a problem or symptom related to at least one knee joint and can give informed consent to participation in the study.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: History of a known non-degenerative arthritic condition such as rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosis or gout, pregnancy, previous history of knee arthroplasty.
